thread.title: Five things you need to know today, and don't yell at your son for his driving while you're hitting traffic cones
thread.title_full: Five things you need to know today, and don't yell at your son for his driving while you're hitting traffic cones

author: Rob Daumeyer
title: Five things you need to know today, and don't yell at your son for his driving while you're hitting traffic cones
text: Five things you need to know today, and don't yell at your son for his driving while you're hitting traffic cones Jul 7, 2015, 7:54am EDT Updated Good morning, Cincinnati! Here are the five most important things you need to know to help start your busy business day: Dallas investor spends $25M for three Cincinnati buildings Five things to know about foot pain, and when to see a specialist : A sponsored message from The Christ Hospital Health Network. P&G settles civil suit over misleading packaging Procter & Gamble Co. will change the packaging for its Olay skin care products to settle a lawsuit , Barrett J. Brunsman reports. The suit was filed by California prosecutors who claimed consumers could be misled by the size of the Olay packaging. P&G didn’t admit to any wrongdoing but agreed to pay $850,000 in civil penalties and legal costs to settle the case filed in California’s Yolo County Superior Court on behalf of consumers in four counties. French firm to operate Cincinnati streetcar As expected, the Southwest Ohio Regional Transit Authority has tapped a French firm to operate Cincinnati’s streetcar , Chris Wetterich reports. Transdev Services, which has its U.S. headquarters in Chicago, was awarded a five-year contract with the option for five years worth of extensions for $38 million. Transdev runs New Orleans’ streetcar, the largest system in the country, as well as rail systems throughout the world. Under the contract, Transdev assumes the risk of cost overruns and must cover them within its fixed price. Developers recalibrate after losing out on historic tax credits We reported last week on the seven Cincinnati projects that received Ohio Historic Tax Credits . But that left 18 local applicants on the outside. Tatum Hunter spoke with several of the folks behind projects that didn't receive the Ohio credits to find out how they plan to move forward . Germans get tough on Greece Should anyone be surprised that GERMANS CHOSE THE HARD PATH in their dealings with Greece over that country's financial debacle? Nein . Late Monday, the German government said it saw no basis for new bailout negotiations and insisted it was up to Athens to move swiftly if it wanted to preserve its place in the euro zone . Chancellor Angela Merkel said the door was still open for negotiations but "time is of the essence" and for the euro zone to keep its single currency all countries need to shoulder responsibility as well as show solidarity. I Spy Cincinnati The quiz is rolling, and I'd hate for you to miss out on a chance at glory and this fantastic prize . So then, here's the latest clue . This day in history On this day 10 years ago, coordinated terrorist bomb blasts struck London's public transport system during morning rush hour, killing 52 and injuring 700. Three of the bombers were British-born sons of Pakistani immigrants. Trending on Google Business News
